alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 6:40AM EDT until April 18 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Chocolay River near Harvey affecting Marquette County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. Black River near Bessemer affecting Gogebic County. .Snowmelt will lead to high river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.9 feet, Water reaches the bottom girder of the M-35 bridge * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:20 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Friday morning to a crest of 7.5 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.9 feet on 04/17/2002. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 400 PM EDT /300 PM CDT/.
